intro: Oenothera luciae, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening and close by morning. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating a high degree of drought tolerance. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss. Oenothera luciae is often found in sandy soils and is a member of the Onagraceae family.
